intro: Harnieria, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that often appear in clusters, typically in shades of white or pale pink. The plants are evergreen shrubs that thrive in acidic, well-drained soils, often found in mountainous regions. Harnieria species are known for their ornamental value and are cultivated for their delicate, ephemeral blooms. They are also valued in horticulture for their ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
